required_tools.description: The bottle containing the whisky, which is used to pour the liquid into the glass.
A suitable drinking glass (e.g., tumbler, whisky glass) to hold the poured whisky.
A small tool for measuring exact quantities of whisky if precision is required.
If the whisky bottle has a cork or seal, a bottle opener or corkscrew may be required to open it.

required_conditions.description: The glass should be placed on a flat, stable surface to prevent spillage during pouring.
The glass should be positioned securely to avoid tilting or spilling as whisky is poured.
The whisky bottle should be tilted at the right angle to ensure smooth and controlled pouring.
Pour at a steady pace to avoid overfilling the glass or spilling the liquid.
Ensure the whisky is at an ideal temperature (room temperature or slightly chilled, depending on preference).
